description.en: The course will draw attention to the essence, principles and definitions of international crimes, as well as to various possibilities to handle them on international or internal level. Special attention will be drawn to definitions and procedural aspects of international crimes in Estonia.
description.et: Vaadeldakse rahvusvaheliste kuritegude olemust, põhimõtteid ja kuriteokoosseise, samuti rahvusvaheliste kuritegude menetlemise võimalusi rahvusvahelisel ja ka siseriiklikul tasandil. Eraldi tähelepanu pööratakse rahvusvaheliste kuritegude koosseisudele ja menetluslikele aspektidele Eestis.

objectives.en: To give an overview of the progressively developing discipline of international criminal law: to introduce students with respective international instruments, court practice and academic writings. To teach students to see and analyze the theoretical and practical issues of international criminal law.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade progresseeruvalt arenevast õigusharust - rahvusvahelisest kriminaalõigusest: viia üliõpilased kurssi asjakohase rahvusvahelise normatiivmaterjali, kohtupraktika ja erialakirjandusega. Õpetada nägema ja analüüsima rahvusvahelise kriminaalõiguse teoreetilisi ja praktilisi probleeme.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course students have to:
- be able to explain the principles and fundamental concepts of international criminal law;
learning_outcomes.et: - võimeline selgitama rahvusvahelise kriminaalõiguse põhimõtteid ja põhimõisteid;

learning_outcomes.en: - be aware of topical issues of international criminal law and be able to discuss them;
learning_outcomes.et: - teadlik rahvusvahelise kriminaalõiguse aktuaalsetest probleemidest ja suutma nende üle arutleda;

learning_outcomes.en: - be able to orientate in the relevant institutions and instruments
learning_outcomes.et: - võimeline orienteeruma rahvusvahelise kriminaalõiguse olulistes institutsioonides ja normatiivdokumentides

independent_work.et:
Essee vabalt valitud rahvusvahelise kriminaalõiguse aktuaalset problemaatikat käsitleval teemal. Essee maht on 15000 tähemärki. NB! See käib essee sisu kohta, arvestamata bibligraafiat, tiitellehte jms.
Essee tuleb saata e-maili aadressile andres.parmas@ut.ee 1. detsembriks.

Essay on a topical issue of International criminal law (based on student's own choice) - 15 000 letters. NB! The letter-count does not include the title page, bibliography etc, only the pure text of the essay is taken into account.
Essay has to be sent to the e-mail: andres.parmas@ut.ee by 1 December.

Kursuse lehele moodle'sse üles laetud kaasuste lahendamine - lahendused tuleb üles laadida vastava teema kollokviumi toimumise päevaks.

Solving of cases that are available on Moodle page for the course. The solutions have to be uploaded by the day of colloquium in respective topic.

Essay
Conformity of the drafting with the formal requirements and correctness of it, analytical skills, creation of connections between various issues, the level of Juridical interpretation, consistency of the approach

E - the text generally conforms to the formal requirements, there are elements of analysis and independent interpretation traceable in the text, but the text is inconsistent
D - the text generally conforms to the formal requirements, the text contains independent analysis and interpretaion, but it remains hazy at times, the chosen approach is generally consistent
C - the text generally conforms to the formal requirements, analytical skills demonstrated and interpretation offered is credible, the chosen approach is generally consistent, but there are some weaknesses when looking at the text as a whole
B - the text conforms to the formal requirements, the chosen approach is consistent, it is based on thorough analysis of the references, the writing is smooth
A - the text conforms to the formal requirements, the level of analysis is outstanding, connections made are resourceful, the approach is fresh, the text is consistent and remarkable as a whole

grade_preconditions.et:
Osalemine vähemalt 75% kollokviumidest; essee ja kaauste lahenduste tähtaegne esitamine.
The students have to participate at least in 75% of the classes; the essay has to be submitted on time; the exercises on the web-platform have to be submitted on time

grade_evaluation.et:
Lõpphinde kujunemisel võetakse hinnet tõstva elemendina arvesse kollokviumidel diskussioonis osalemist; 40% ulatuses sõltub lõpphinne essee hindest ning 60% ulatuses eksamikaasuse hindest.

For the final grade participation in the class-room discussions will be taken into account as a bonus. The essay gives 40% and the written examination gives 60% of the final grade.

debt_elimination.et:
Kokkuleppel õppejõuga, üldjuhul tuleb liiga suure puudumiste arvu korral kursus uuesti läbida. Essee hilinenud esitamisel langeb sellele antav hinne iga hilinetud päeva kohta ühe palli. Samuti langeb hinne ühe palli iga puuduoleva 1000 tähemärgi kohta nõutavast mahust.

Only as agreed with the lecturer. As a rule, when the number of allowed absence is exceeded, the course has to be taken anew. In case of delayed submission of the essay, the mark is lowered by one grade for each delayed day and by one grade for each missing 1000 letters in the text as compared to the required letter-count.
